list_definition.definition: to come face to face with (eg a person whom one knows), by chance

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She met a man on the train.

list_definition.definition: (sometimes, especially American, with with) to come together with (a person etc), by arrangement
to be introduced to (someone) for the first time

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Where do the two roads meet?

list_definition.definition: to be equal to or satisfy (eg a person’s needs, requirements etc)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Will there be sufficient stocks to meet the public demand?

list_definition.definition: to come into the view, experience or presence of

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: A terrible sight met him / his eyes when he opened the door.

list_definition.definition: to come to or be faced with

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He met his death in a car accident.

list_definition.definition: (with with) to experience or suffer; to receive a particular response

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The scheme met with their approval.
We will meet force with greater force.
The local athletics club are holding a meet this week.
